form.official-title: To require intelligence community reporting on foreign fighter flows to and from terrorist safe havens abroad, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tracking Foreign Fighters in Terrorist Safe Havens Act.

section.header: Intelligence community reporting to Congress on foreign fighter flows

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and every 180 days thereafter, the Director of National Intelligence, consistent with the protection of intelligence sources and methods, shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on foreign fighter flows to and from terrorist safe havens abroad.
Each report submitted under subsection (a) shall include, with respect to each terrorist safe haven, the following:

paragraph.text: The total number of foreign fighters who have traveled or are suspected of having traveled to the terrorist safe haven since 2011, including the countries of origin of such foreign fighters.
The total number of United States citizens present in the terrorist safe haven.
The total number of foreign fighters who have left the terrorist safe haven or whose whereabouts are unknown.

subsection.text: The reports submitted under subsection (a) may be submitted in classified form. If such a report is submitted in classified form, such report shall also include an unclassified summary.
The requirement to submit reports under subsection (a) shall terminate on the date that is two years after the date of the enactment of this Act.
In this section, the term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs;
the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs;
the Committee on Foreign Relations; and
the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence;
the Committee on Foreign Affairs; and
